This project will integrate the use of social behavior change communication (SBCC) techniques to address HIV/AIDS-related health behaviors and issues. The goal is to support the GOT's national goal of reducing HIV infections. In support of the PEPFAR Blueprint and GHI strategy, the project will engage with stakeholders at all levels with the goal of achieving focused on key and vulnerable populations in 6 priority regions. The project will expand the impact of current PEPFAR/T funded SBCC initiative that is aligned with measurable behavioral outcomes in HIV/AIDS, specifically improved attitudes and enabling environment towards HIV; increased comprehensive HIV knowledge; and increased use of services and products such as VMMC, ART retention, and condoms. Gender equity and strengthening the capacity of local organizations to implement SBCC programs will be considered at every stage of the project. This project will achieve greater health impact through strategic integration of interventions. Cost efficiencies will be realized through co-sharing activities with family planning, malaria, and maternal and child health funds. This program will build on the work of the JHU Tanzania Capacity and Communication Project. Findings from the end of project evaluation will be used to streamline this TBD to focus on targeted interventions with highest potential for impact. M&E activities utilizing surveys and formative research are planned.
